EmailTemplate.subject: Thank You for Joining Pivotal and the Spring Team at Devoxx Poland 2015
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Hello {{lead.First Name:default=There}},
Did we meet you, or did you hear from us at Devoxx Poland <http://www.devoxx.pl>? We’re coming to conferences like Devoxx to specifically to help developers learn that cloud-native application architectures aren’t just available to pioneers like Netflix anymore - Spring and Cloud Foundry are making it accessible. Grab a free copy of the 50 page concept primer from O'Reilly - “Migrating to Cloud Native Application Architecture <http://pivotal.io/platform-as-a-service/migrating-to-cloud-native-application-architectures-ebook?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=devoxx-poland-q315>”.
If you weren't able to catch our talks, cool schwag, or technology, here’s a quick recap:
- Juergen Hoeller gave a well attended talk on Modern Java Component Design with Spring Framework 4.2, and also showed us what’s coming in future releases in a separate roadmap short talk, and an evening BOF. - Josh Long showed developers how NetFlixOSS components are being integrated into the Spring programming model with “Bootiful” microservices with Spring Cloud”. - Josh Long showed us the container at base of the microservice stack, Spring Boot in his talk “Bootiful Applications with Spring Boot” - Pieter Humphrey explained how to Deploy Microservice Architectures with Spring Cloud on Cloud Foundry, discussing how NetflixOSS is integrated to both the Spring programming model as well as Pivotal Cloud Foundry. - Thomas Darimont from the Spring Data project gave a whirlwind tour of what’s new recent releases like “Fowler” and a peek at the upcoming “Gosling” release.
- Familiar with Kubernetes or Mesos? Great! Download Lattice.cf <http://lattice.cf> today and get started with Spring Cloud via vagrant on your local machine or via AWS, using Cloud Foudry’s advanced “diego” scheduler, self-healing, http load balancer, and log aggregation.
If NetflixOSS gets you excited about the future, make sure to learn more now:
- CF Summit 2015 talk: Deploying Microservice Architectures with Cloud Foundry <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DBIm6gDpSNg>
- Check out the Spring Cloud Services 1.0.0 beta <https://network.pivotal.io/products/p-spring-cloud-services>, which integrates the open source Spring Cloud project <http://projects.spring.io/spring-cloud> with Pivotal Cloud Foundry. - Sign up for two months of Free Pivotal Web Services <http://run.pivotal.io>, simply the best public cloud environment for hosting Spring & Java applications available today.
- Coté and Andrew Clay Shafer talk about DevOps - in one of our recent Pivotal Conversations podcasts. - Learn about the Cloud-Native Enterprise from James Watters’ CF Summit keynote here <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xA-674cNI3w>.
Stay in touch with Pivotal and join the conversation on our blogs <http://spring.io/blog>, YouTube <http://spring.io/video>, and on Twitter <https://twitter.com/springcentral>.
We hope to see you again soon at a future event <https://pivotal.io/news-events?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=devoxx-poland-q315>!
The Spring Team at Pivotal
